markdownRemark.html:
Initially it seemed that Twilio doesn’t have the capability to run our SMS bots. However after we dove deeper in its feature set, we found a way to repurpose them to achieve what we need.

How Twilio Works

explain the features we used and what do they do, but simply. “we have tasks, tasks can do actions such as sending a message response and listen for a yes/no answer. however after a task finishes, there is no logic that starts another task based on the response.”

twilio also allows us to upload custom code that gets triggered when a user sends a message. This code can be used to launch tasks and retrieve the results from tasks.

How We Use These Twilio Features

TODO

below I copied the relevant content from our blogs which might be useful.

We found that there isn’t a unified JSON definition for an Autopilot bot. You would need to use the REST API to create an Assistant resource and then Create Task resources for that Assistant (and Samples/Field Types) to create a complete bot.

The JSON diagram that is generated by Voiceflow seems to be the format required for an Amazon Lex bot. We looked at if there is a way we can easily port the JSON into a Twilio bot but currently Twilio only supports this with dialogflow integration.

Since Twilio Autopilot doesn’t natively support this integration, we found a community-developed plugin called Autopilot CLI developed by dabblelabs.  This plugin allows you to create, delete and edit bots and more or less has the functionality we need.

If the sequence of questions can change based on the answers of previous questions, you would not be able to declaratively define all the questions in JSON.  Because Autopilot will attempt to ask all the questions that are in the JSON.

Twilio Autopilot CLI

Since Twilio doesn’t support nested questions. You go to one question based on the response from a previous question.

  • Benefits

    With the CLI you are able to create a Twilio Task where you ask one question, if it recognises a Yes intent you redirect to the next question and if it recognises a No internet it will redirect you to a different question.

  • Drawbacks

    Although this is enough for us to do what we want, one dependency is this plugin and it is unclear how long it will be maintained for. It doesn’t seem to have a massive community behind it, only a couple of devs.

Twilio TwiML

TwiML (the Twilio Markup Language) is a set of instructions you can use to tell Twilio what to do when you receive an incoming call, SMS, or fax.

  • Benefits

    We can split questions up into separate XML files and have a main program that displays the next option based on the user response.

  • Drawbacks

    With TwiML it is not as powerful and feature-rich as Autopilot.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Response>
	<Gather action="switch.php" method="POST">
		<Say>To listen to a robot speak, press 1.</Say>
		<Say>To call a fake movie number, press 2.</Say>
	</Gather>
</Response>
<?php

switch ($_REQUEST['Digits']):
    case '1':
        include('option-1.xml');
        break;
    case '2':
        include('option-2.xml');
        break;
    default:
        include('index.xml');
endswitch;
